intro: Brachypterys australis, commonly known as the southern rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Brachypterys australis is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
